alert.note: Alert for Galveston; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 4:35PM CDT until August 18 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Galveston and Harris. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Pasadena, northeastern League City, La Porte, Deer Park, Seabrook, Webster, Kemah, Clear Lake, Nassau Bay, Taylor Lake Village, El Lago, Shoreacres, Clear Lake Shores, Morgan`s Point, The Johnson Space Center and Kemah Boardwalk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
